modules.description: This module implements a buffer management system with dynamic allocation policies, specifically handling `Bytes.t` buffers backed by a custom OCaml type `t`. It provides operations to create an empty buffer with a specified size limit (`empty`), access the underlying byte buffer (`data`), and safely extend the buffer to a new length (`extend`), ensuring bounds and allocation limits are respected. Concrete use cases include parsing and handling OpenSSL configuration data where controlled buffer growth and memory safety are critical.

This module provides low-level I/O operations for reading lines from input channels, specifically designed for handling OpenSSL config file parsing. It works directly with `in_channel` and mutable byte buffers to efficiently read and process line-based input. A concrete use case is parsing OpenSSL configuration files where line boundaries and byte-level control are critical for correct interpretation of the file structure.

This module parses OpenSSL configuration files into structured data, supporting operations to load files, retrieve values by name or section, and handle name substitution within values. It works with strings, sections, and stacks of name-value pairs, producing optional results for lookups. Concrete use cases include reading and processing OpenSSL config files for certificate generation or TLS configuration without relying on external tools.
